column4: has anyone run into alsamixer showing a level of zero (0) and cannot be changed?
yeah but then i compiled alsa and it was fine
it happend after a kernel upgrade
you'll need the driver for sound for your new kernel
did yuor system work ok with the old kernel?
i have it. the module exists. alsa loads it properly and aplay shows the correct driver. even /dev/urandom | aplay works fine
it did work, in the kernel on the live CD
then you dont need the newer kernel, the old one is fine
bahh I'll try installing the old one
kernels provide harware and memory access
if your system is doing all those fine you do NOT need to upgrade the kernel
i know all that. it just surprised me ;)
have you not found a ppa for it?
brainstorm isn't a place to raise ideas? :)
yeah, an idea to compile a package, if its inappropriate it will be moved to the right place
